weather_report:
The morning in Downtown San Francisco carries a whisper of rain, blanketing the city in a soft gray. Clouds loom thickly, shrouding familiar landmarks in an ethereal veil, with visibility diminished and the air rich with the scent of wet earth. The temperature lingers in the mid-50s, promising a steady drop as the afternoon approaches. With a relentless 100% chance of rain, one cannot escape the likelihood of a heavy downpour, possibly accumulating to half an inch. As the day deepens, the air will grow cooler, shifting to a brisk comfort for those venturing out—wrap yourself in layers, perhaps a waterproof jacket and sturdy boots to navigate the slicked streets.

As the sun dips towards the horizon, the chance of rain may recede slightly, yielding a quiet respite as the clouds remain watchful, cloaking the city in their embrace. Tonight’s low settles at a cool 49, with a gentle north-northwest breeze nudging through. A casual walk through the dampened streets may yield quiet delights—an open café beckons, the warmth of a fresh brew juxtaposed against the cool evening air. It is a night for leisurely pursuits, perhaps a stroll by the waterfront where the sounds of the city blend harmoniously with the rhythmic patter of raindrops. Under this muted sky, a tapestry of gray defines the mood—soft, serene, urging you to blend into the gentle cadence of the elements unraveling around you.
